title: When is it appropriate to use “could” and “couldn't” in a sentence? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Could” is the subjunctive version of “can,” the ability to do something. When you can do something, you are able to do it. If you could do something, something in the context makes the statement contrary to fact. For example, “I could do it, but I don’t have the tools.” “We could do it if we ever get our act together.” “Couldn’t” is the negative of “could.” For example, “I couldn’t do it because I didn’t have the tools.”
